0.Pros: They employ young persons for eg. High school students, college students with no prior experience. This opportunity assist many of us to gain experience and some well needed funds.
0.Cons: Some of the managers would shout at you in the presence of everyone else.

1.Cons: Not enough hours, short staffed, hardly any recognition, highly stressful, fight for advancement.

2.Pros: -half off food during your break-flexible schedules-fast paced work

4.Pros: Enjoyed the free food during my shifts.
4.Cons: Pay is not great. People look down on you.

6.Cons: Not long termManagement is sometimes lazy

7.Pros: It may have just been my location based on other reviews but working at McDonald's was very rewarding for me. Even though I was hired on as part-time it was easy to pick up full-time hours if you needed the money. My management team made me feel valued as an employee and you weren't criticized for making mistakes. I also observed many employees quickly making their way up the management ladder if they showed dedication and a willingness to learn.
7.Cons: The customers were always hit or miss depending on the day, but like most food service jobs they can make or break how your days will go.

8.Pros: Great staff and opportunities to move up

9.Pros: Great company to work for. Upward mobility & growth. Regularly scheduled raises. Free food or discounts.
9.Cons: Working with a lot of kids.
